content:
As I plan future VUG sessions, I am always thinking about when is the best time to encourage more participation from folks who live in different time zones.

Let's do quick and informal poll of folks in Zulip. If you would like us to try and schedule meetings at a different time of day than our weekly Outreach, Design/UX, and Development meetings. Please, post a quick note with the following info.

1) What is your time zone?
2) What times of day work best for you to participate in live meetings (use your local time)

Personally, I live in the Central Time Zone in the USA and my preferences for meeting times are:
1) 12:00 - 4:00pm (Central Time Zone)
2) 8:00 - 10:00pm (Central Time Zone)

AEDT:

  • 9am-11am
  • 12pm-5pm
  • 8pm-11pm
    (these are times I'm currently available, not order of preference)
You know me ...if I really want to join a meeting, then I "make" time :sweat_smile:
@Olaf Grabienski - What is a good time of the day or day of the week for you. We'd like to stick with Tuesday, but are open to other ideas?

So, my time zone is Central European Time (CET). Best time of the day is usually between 10am and 3pm. On some days, a bit later (until 6pm) or a lot later (10pm to midnight) is also possible; these days aren't the same every week, though.
